page.title: 08BRITISH TELECOM - MARTLESHAM
page.content: {The British Telecom Research Laboratories} opened on a l00 acre wooded site at Martlesham in 1975 1,700 people moved into the new laboratories which today house more than 2,400 people. Some 1,500 are professional engineers,scientists or mathematicians. About 800 technicians provide technical support and many of these are recruited locally and trained at Martlesham. Up to 200 graduates are recruited each year from the best in the country. Some of the many new buildings are general purpose like the main laboratory block which dominates the landscape. Many have been built to meet specific needs such as a large Â£clean area' for processing intigrated circuits or the special facility for testing submarine cables at simulated deep-ocean pressures.
